bug.text: After the fix on 17 August (see the update.log), when an unexpected user exception was raised in an up-call, the Python error status would not be properly cleared. This meant that later up-calls could fail with exceptions of the form "AttributeError: minor", even when the code didn't mention "minor" at all.

bug.summary: omniidl back-end generates useless classes for typedef to struct/union
bug.text: The Python mapping specification is totally silent on the issue of typedefs. The only thing it says is that something must be generated for all declared types, to be passed to CORBA.id(). It does make sense to allow typedef names to be used to contruct structs and unions, though.
